newsitem.title: UK: LucasVarity engine unit gets 80 mln stg deal.
newsitem.headline: LucasVarity engine unit gets 80 mln stg deal.

text.p: Anglo-American company LucasVarity Plc said on Friday its diesel engine division, VarityPerkins, won an 80 million stg engine order from NACCO Materials Handling Group Inc.
LucasVarity said the unit would supply its 700 Series engine to NACCO's Northern Ireland facility in Craigavon beginning in early 1998.
The engines will be used in forklift trucks.
Total volumes were expected to start at 4,000 and rise to 10,000 when the agreement matured, LucasVarity said in a statement.
VarityPerkins already supplies engines to NACCO's plants in North America, the Netherlands and Scotland.
